intro: Feuilleea endlicheri, commonly known as the mountain featherplant, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and delicate, feather-like leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. Due to its habitat in high-altitude regions, it is adapted to cold temperatures and low atmospheric pressure.
